channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mud and debris from unauthorised driveway making pavement slippery for pedestrians., 1st February
item.description:
5 Howard Place Hucclecote Rd. Mud and debris from unauthorised driveway access causing pavement to be slippery for pedestrians. Has been an ongoing issue for some time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several pot holes need repair, 1st February
item.description:
Road needs resurfacing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Granley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: You cleared two drains previously but did not rod or hose it thru as blocked in the pipe . It blocks , overflows and rain water rubs down washing the mud down to the bridge where it floods and now looks awful with a mud bath, 1st February
item.description:
As you come off the main ciren road north park farm is on the left . As you pass the first sharp bend the ka drain is positioned 109 foot down on the right by the railings .. there is also one opposite .. unless these are hosed thru they Bloch up in a day as last time .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot holes on Ashcot Mews, 1st February
item.description:
Outside number 13/4 and throughout the cup-de-sac. Very large potholes and whole road needs resurfacing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Ashcot Mews, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Abandonded Caravan, 1st February
item.description:
This silly little 'layby' normally polluted with rubbish is now housing an abandoned caravan There is a number plate on the back of it as per photo(s)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: Multiple large potholes, 1st February
item.description:
Double mini roundabout by the kind Edward pub, been a growing problem since the last frosts now has people driving over the roundabouts/around them the wrong way to get clear of the pot holes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes on Sandyleaze Road, 1st February
item.description:
Multiple potholes in the Sandyleaze and surrounding roads leading onto Nine Elms Road very large potholes. A cyclist riding in the dark could get seriously injured, also when driving and potholes are filled with rain water not realising how deep the potholes are would damage a car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandyleaze, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes on both sides of road, 1st February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Athelney Way, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.title: Several large pot holes on left hand side driving from Down Hatherley lane to innsworth lane, 31st January
item.description:
Too many potholes to list individually, the left side of the road is gradually being warn away The majority of frog furling lane is affected going towards innsworth lane. This is a health and safety issue as cars trying to miss potholes are further into the path of oncoming traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frog Furlong Lane, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
